intro: Rheedia calyptrata, commonly known as the Cape snowflake, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its striking, white, star-shaped flowers that resemble snowflakes. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in full sun. It has lance-shaped leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Rheedia calyptrata is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and is relatively drought-tolerant once established.
